items.title: US signals room on Ukraine plan ahead of Geneva talks, denies pushing Russian 'wish list'
items.standfirst: Washington signalled room for negotiation on a 28-point plan to end the Ukraine war, denying claims by US senators that it is a Russian "wish list," as Kyiv and European allies criticised the proposal ahead of Sunday talks in Geneva.

items.title: US senators say they spoke with Rubio about Trump’s Ukraine peace plan who denied it is a US plan
Western leaders at G20 say US peace plan for Ukraine ‘will require work’
items.standfirst: European leaders say Washington’s proposal needs major changes, as Macron warns G20 risks losing relevanceWestern leaders have said the US peace plan for ending the war in Ukraine “will require additional work” at the G20 summit in Johannesburg, which Donald Trump boycotted.The draft plan, which was leaked this week, endorsed some of Russia’s demands, such as handing over areas of Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region, limiting its military, and relinquishing its ambitions to join Nato. Washington has given Kyiv a deadline of Thursday to respond. Continue reading...
items.content: European leaders say Washington’s proposal needs major changes, as Macron warns G20 risks losing relevanceWestern leaders have said the US peace plan for ending the war in Ukraine “will require additional work” at the G20 summit in Johannesburg, which Donald Trump boycotted.The draft plan, which was leaked this week, endorsed some of Russia’s demands, such as handing over areas of Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region, limiting its military, and relinquishing its ambitions to join Nato. Washington has given Kyiv a deadline of Thursday to respond. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says Ukraine peace plan isn't his 'final offer' to Zelenskyy
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said that his administration’s peace proposal for Ukraine and Russia is “not my final offer."
items.content: President Donald Trump said that his administration’s peace proposal for Ukraine and Russia is “not my final offer."

items.title: European leaders say US plan for Ukraine 'requires additional work' ahead of Geneva talks
items.standfirst: Ukraine said Saturday that its officials will meet US counterparts in Switzerland to discuss Washington’s proposed peace plan. Kyiv will seek to push back against provisions that mirror some of Moscow’s toughest demands, while European leaders said the US plan "is a basis which will require additional work".
items.content: Ukraine said Saturday that its officials will meet US counterparts in Switzerland to discuss Washington’s proposed peace plan. Kyiv will seek to push back against provisions that mirror some of Moscow’s toughest demands, while European leaders said the US plan "is a basis which will require additional work".

items.title: US denies Ukraine peace plan is 'Russian wish list' - as talks over ending war to be held in Switzerland
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has said that his 28-point peace plan for Ukraine is "by far" not the "final offer", ahead of crisis talks in Geneva.
items.content: Donald Trump has said that his 28-point peace plan for Ukraine is "by far" not the "final offer", ahead of crisis talks in Geneva.

ai_summary: US officials deny the 28-point peace plan was a Russian "wish list" as claimed by some senators.
President Trump stated the plan is not his final offer for ending the Ukraine-Russia conflict.
Ukrainian and US officials are scheduled to meet in Geneva for negotiations on the plan.
Some US senators claimed the plan was authored by Moscow, not Washington.
The State Department's spokesperson denied the claim that Russia authored the plan.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro arrested after being deemed a flight risk
items.standfirst: The former Brazilian president is suspected of damaging an ankle bracelet as part of an alleged escape plan.
items.content: The former Brazilian president is suspected of damaging an ankle bracelet as part of an alleged escape plan.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro arrested after tampering with ankle tag ‘out of curiosity’
items.standfirst: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. Continue reading...
items.content: Brazilian ex-president says he used soldering iron on device and is now in custody over fears he was going to abscondBrazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro has claimed he tried to damage his electronic ankle monitor “out of curiosity” after he was arrested at his villa owing to suspicions he was poised to abscond.In a video released by the supreme court, Bolsonaro – who was recently sentenced to 27 years in prison for masterminding a military coup – can be heard admitting to a security official that he had used a soldering iron to tamper with the black tag. items.title: Brazilian court orders preemptive arrest of former president Jair Bolsonaro
items.standfirst: Jair Bolsonaro has been taken into custody after being deemed a “concrete flight risk” while under house arrest. The former Brazilian president was convicted in September of plotting a military coup and sentenced to more than 27 years in prison, though he has remained under house arrest while his appeals proceed. Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes said the decision to detain the 70-year-old was a preventive measure prompted by “new facts” that had recently emerged. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle shares his insights.
items.content: Jair Bolsonaro has been taken into custody after being deemed a “concrete flight risk” while under house arrest. The former Brazilian president was convicted in September of plotting a military coup and sentenced to more than 27 years in prison, though he has remained under house arrest while his appeals proceed. Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes said the decision to detain the 70-year-old was a preventive measure prompted by “new facts” that had recently emerged. France24 International Affairs Editor Philip Turle shares his insights.

items.title: Former president Jair Bolsonaro arrested due to "flight risk"
items.standfirst: Federal police detained Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro on Saturday after a Supreme Court judge deemed the far-right firebrand a "high flight risk". The arrest comes just days before Bolsonaro is due to begin a 27-year prison term for leading a botched coup attempt. Caroline Baum reports.
items.content: Federal police detained Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro on Saturday after a Supreme Court judge deemed the far-right firebrand a "high flight risk". The arrest comes just days before Bolsonaro is due to begin a 27-year prison term for leading a botched coup attempt. Caroline Baum reports.

items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro arrested for allegedly plotting escape ahead of prison term
items.standfirst: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the arrest of Jair Bolsonaro, with a judge claiming the former president was intent on escaping as he was set to begin his prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.
items.content: Brazil's Supreme Court ordered the arrest of Jair Bolsonaro, with a judge claiming the former president was intent on escaping as he was set to begin his prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.(Image credit: Luis Nova)

items.title: Ex-Brazil president 'tried to open ankle monitor' with soldering iron in 'escape attempt'
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has been arrested after allegedly trying to open his ankle monitor with a soldering iron in a bid to flee and avoid a jail term, according to court documents.
items.content: Former Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has been arrested after allegedly trying to open his ankle monitor with a soldering iron in a bid to flee and avoid a jail term, according to court documents.

items.title: Brazil’s Bolsonaro detained for damaging ankle monitor
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian president, who is under house arrest, admits to using a soldering iron on the monitoring bracelet.
items.content: Former Brazilian president, who is under house arrest, admits to using a soldering iron on the monitoring bracelet.

items.title: Brazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro arrested, lawyer says
items.standfirst: Federal police on Saturday arrested Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro, who was sentenced to jail earlier this year over a botched coup attempt, his lawyer confirmed. The arrest comes a week after a court rejected Bolsonaro's appeal of his 27-year prison term. FRANCE 24 correspondent Tim Vickery reports the latest from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
items.content: Federal police on Saturday arrested Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro, who was sentenced to jail earlier this year over a botched coup attempt, his lawyer confirmed. The arrest comes a week after a court rejected Bolsonaro's appeal of his 27-year prison term. FRANCE 24 correspondent Tim Vickery reports the latest from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro detained for attempting to break ankle bracelet and escape
items.standfirst: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro, under house arrest while he appeals a conviction for a foiled coup attempt, was detained Saturday after the Supreme Court deemed him a high flight risk. The court said the far-right leader had tried to disable his ankle monitor in order to escape.
items.content: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro, under house arrest while he appeals a conviction for a foiled coup attempt, was detained Saturday after the Supreme Court deemed him a high flight risk. The court said the far-right leader had tried to disable his ankle monitor in order to escape.

ai_summary: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was arrested after being deemed a flight risk.
Bolsonaro is suspected of tampering with his electronic ankle monitor, allegedly with a soldering iron.
He was sentenced to over 27 years in prison for allegedly masterminding a military coup.
A Brazilian court ordered his preemptive arrest due to "new facts" that emerged.
Bolsonaro claimed he damaged the ankle monitor out of curiosity.

The strikes are the latest test to the fragile ceasefire that began on October 10.

clusters.title: JFK's granddaughter reveals terminal cancer diagnosis, criticizes cousin RFK Jr
clusters.neutral_headline: JFK's Granddaughter Announces Terminal Cancer Diagnosis

items.title: JFK's granddaughter reveals terminal cancer diagnosis, criticizes cousin RFK Jr
Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of JFK, announces terminal cancer diagnosis
items.standfirst: Journalist, daughter of Caroline Kennedy and Edwin Schlossberg, reveals she has acute myeloid leukemiaTatiana Schlossberg, a journalist and the granddaughter of John F Kennedy, disclosed on Saturday that she has been diagnosed with terminal cancer, saying her doctor informed her that she has less than a year left to live.The environmental writer also addressed her cousin, Robert F Kennedy Jr, criticizing the influence his policies as secretary of health and human services have had on her experience with the illness. Continue reading...
items.content: Journalist, daughter of Caroline Kennedy and Edwin Schlossberg, reveals she has acute myeloid leukemiaTatiana Schlossberg, a journalist and the granddaughter of John F Kennedy, disclosed on Saturday that she has been diagnosed with terminal cancer, saying her doctor informed her that she has less than a year left to live.The environmental writer also addressed her cousin, Robert F Kennedy Jr, criticizing the influence his policies as secretary of health and human services have had on her experience with the illness. Continue reading...

items.title: JFK's granddaughter shares terminal cancer diagnosis
items.standfirst: Tatiana Schlossberg, 35, says she was diagnosed shortly after giving birth in 2024 and has less than a year to live.
items.content: Tatiana Schlossberg, 35, says she was diagnosed shortly after giving birth in 2024 and has less than a year to live.

ai_summary: Tatiana Schlossberg, JFK's granddaughter, has been diagnosed with terminal cancer.
She stated she has less than a year to live, according to her doctor.
She criticized her cousin, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., regarding his policies.
She was diagnosed shortly after giving birth in 2024.
Schlossberg is a journalist and environmental writer.

clusters.title: Trump says Ukraine deal is not ‘final offer’ as officials gather for Geneva summit
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump's Ukraine Peace Plan Faces Scrutiny

items.title: Trump says Ukraine deal is not ‘final offer’ as officials gather for Geneva summit
items.standfirst: US president signals potential room for adjustments after Zelenskyy says proposals force Ukraine to choose between national dignity and losing the USDonald Trump said on Saturday that his Moscow-drafted “peace plan” was “not my final offer”, after a furious backlash from Ukrainians who described it as reminiscent of Neville Chamberlain’s 1938 Munich agreement with Adolf Hitler.The US president told reporters during brief remarks at the White House: “We’d like to get to peace. It should’ve happened a long time ago … we’re trying to get it ended, one way or the other we have to get it ended.” Continue reading...
items.content: US president signals potential room for adjustments after Zelenskyy says proposals force Ukraine to choose between national dignity and losing the USDonald Trump said on Saturday that his Moscow-drafted “peace plan” was “not my final offer”, after a furious backlash from Ukrainians who described it as reminiscent of Neville Chamberlain’s 1938 Munich agreement with Adolf Hitler.The US president told reporters during brief remarks at the White House: “We’d like to get to peace. It should’ve happened a long time ago … we’re trying to get it ended, one way or the other we have to get it ended.” Continue reading...

items.title: Ukraine’s allies say more work needed on US plan to end Russia’s war

items.content: US President Donald Trump gave Ukraine until Thursday to approve the 28-point plan to end the nearly four-year war.

items.title: Trump’s new Thanksgiving deadline for Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: President Trump said Ukraine had a Thursday deadline to give an answer on his new 28-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine. NBC News’ Keir Simmons reports.
items.content: President Trump said Ukraine had a Thursday deadline to give an answer on his new 28-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine. NBC News’ Keir Simmons reports.

items.title: White House urges Ukraine to accept peace plan as Zelenskyy weighs repercussions
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials
items.content: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials

ai_summary: Donald Trump said his Ukraine peace plan is not his final offer.
Ukraine has a Thursday deadline to approve the 28-point peace plan.
The White House wants Kyiv to sign the peace plan by Thanksgiving.
Ukrainian President Zelenskyy warned the deal forces a choice between dignity and a key partner.
Allies of Ukraine say more work is needed on the US plan.

items.content: US President Donald Trump and New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani met on Friday after weeks of trading barbs.

items.title: Trump praises New York mayor-elect Mamdani at warm White House meeting
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump and New York's incoming progressive mayor Zohran Mamdani were all smiles at a White House meeting on Friday, promising to set aside months of bitter feuding and cooperate on the city's future. Trump, who had previously labelled Mamdani a "100% Communist Lunatic", said the incoming mayor would do a "great job" leading the nation's biggest city. Morgan Ayre reports.
items.content: US President Donald Trump and New York's incoming progressive mayor Zohran Mamdani were all smiles at a White House meeting on Friday, promising to set aside months of bitter feuding and cooperate on the city's future. Trump, who had previously labelled Mamdani a "100% Communist Lunatic", said the incoming mayor would do a "great job" leading the nation's biggest city. Morgan Ayre reports.

ai_summary: Donald Trump met with New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani in the White House.
Trump praised Mamdani, despite previous insults, and said he would do a "great job".
Mamdani called Trump a "fascist" during the meeting, which Trump said he didn't mind.
Mamdani stated Israel is committing genocide in Gaza during the meeting.
The two leaders discussed the cost of living in New York City.

During an all-hands meeting earlier…

items.title: Google tells employees it must double capacity every 6 months to meet AI demand
items.standfirst: Google's AI infrastructure chief tells staff it needs thousandfold capacity increase in 5 years.
items.content: While AI bubble talk fills the air these days, with fears of overinvestment that could pop at any time, something of a contradiction is brewing on the ground: Companies like Google and OpenAI can barely build infrastructure fast enough to fill their AI needs. During an all-hands meeting earlier this month, Google’s AI infrastructure head Amin Vahdat told employees that the company must double its serving capacity every six months to meet demand for artificial intelligence services, reports CNBC. The comments show a rare look at what Google executives are telling its own employees internally. Vahdat, a vice president at Google Cloud, presented slides to its employees showing the company needs to scale “the next 1000x in 4-5 years.” While a thousandfold increase in compute capacity sounds ambitious by itself, Vahdat noted some key constraints: Google needs to be able to deliver this increase in capability, compute, and storage networking “for essentially the same cost and increasingly, the same power, the same energy level,” he told employees during the meeting. “It won’t be easy but through collaboration and co-design, we’re going to get there.”Read full article Comments

ai_summary: Google's AI infrastructure chief addressed employees.
The company needs a thousandfold capacity increase in five years.
Google needs to double its capacity every six months.
The demand for AI infrastructure is rapidly increasing.
Google is struggling to build infrastructure quickly enough.

clusters.title: Security fears rise in Nigeria after more than 300 schoolchildren kidnapped
clusters.neutral_headline: Nigeria School Kidnappings Raise Security Fears

items.title: Security fears rise in Nigeria after more than 300 schoolchildren kidnapped
items.standfirst: Christian group revises up number of students and teachers missing after one of country’s largest mass abductionGunmen have kidnapped more than 300 students and teachers in one of the largest mass kidnappings in Nigeria, a Christian group said on Saturday, as security fears mounted in Africa’s most populous nation.The early Friday raid on St Mary’s co-educational school in Niger state in western Nigeria came after gunmen on Monday stormed a secondary school in neighbouring Kebbi state, abducting 25 girls. Continue reading...

items.title: More than 300 children were abducted in an attack on a Catholic school in Nigeria
items.standfirst: A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary's School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria's Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said.
items.content: A total of 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers were abducted by gunmen during an attack on St. Mary's School, a Catholic institution in north-central Nigeria's Niger state, the Christian Association of Nigeria said.(Image credit: Christian Association of Nigeria)

items.title: Nigeria reels after 215 children taken in second mass school abduction in a week
items.standfirst: Twelve teachers also kidnapped from Catholic school amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted 215 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...

clusters.title: End of fossil fuel era inches closer as Cop30 deal agreed after bitter standoff
clusters.neutral_headline: COP30 Climate Deal Reached After Standoff

items.title: End of fossil fuel era inches closer as Cop30 deal agreed after bitter standoff
items.standfirst: Wealthy countries should triple funds for countries to tackle climate impacts, but deforestation and critical minerals blocked from final dealThe world edged a small step closer to the end of the fossil fuel era on Saturday, but not by nearly enough to stave off the ravages of climate breakdown.Countries meeting in Brazil for two weeks could manage only a voluntary agreement to begin discussions on a roadmap to an eventual phase-out of fossil fuels, and they achieved this incremental progress only in the teeth of implacable opposition from oil-producing countries. Continue reading...
items.content: Wealthy countries should triple funds for countries to tackle climate impacts, but deforestation and critical minerals blocked from final dealThe world edged a small step closer to the end of the fossil fuel era on Saturday, but not by nearly enough to stave off the ravages of climate breakdown.Countries meeting in Brazil for two weeks could manage only a voluntary agreement to begin discussions on a roadmap to an eventual phase-out of fossil fuels, and they achieved this incremental progress only in the teeth of implacable opposition from oil-producing countries. Continue reading...

items.title: COP30 summit in Brazil adopts climate deal – after omitting calls to phase out fossil fuels
items.standfirst: The COP30 climate talks in Brazil on Saturday culminated in a final agreement which dropped any explicit call to phase out fossil fuels, despite calls to do so from the EU and dozens of nations. The text showed countries had agreed to accelerate climate action, examine trade barriers linked to it and triple funding for developing nations facing extreme weather.
items.content: The COP30 climate talks in Brazil on Saturday culminated in a final agreement which dropped any explicit call to phase out fossil fuels, despite calls to do so from the EU and dozens of nations. The text showed countries had agreed to accelerate climate action, examine trade barriers linked to it and triple funding for developing nations facing extreme weather.

The agreement was reached after opposition from oil-producing countries.

items.title: G20 declaration adopted unanimously: World leaders defy US boycott to summit in Africa
items.standfirst: World leaders from the Group of 20 rich and developing economies broke with tradition and adopted a declaration at the start of their summit in South Africa on Saturday, despite opposition from the United States, which is boycotting the two-day talks in a diplomatic rift with the host country. Charlotte Lam reports.

clusters.title: Leaders meet for first Africa-hosted G20
clusters.neutral_headline: Africa Hosts First G20 Summit

items.title: Leaders meet for first Africa-hosted G20
items.standfirst: The final document of the Group of 20 summit in South Africa pledges to work toward resolving armed conflicts and easing the burdens on developing nations. Convened on Saturday as the first G20 meeting held on the African continent, the two-day summit set an ambitious agenda to tackle longstanding issues affecting the world’s poorest countries, despite a boycott by the United States. Director of Anglo-American La wat Cergy-Paris University and West African politics expert, Douglas Yates, shares his insights.
items.content: The final document of the Group of 20 summit in South Africa pledges to work toward resolving armed conflicts and easing the burdens on developing nations. Convened on Saturday as the first G20 meeting held on the African continent, the two-day summit set an ambitious agenda to tackle longstanding issues affecting the world’s poorest countries, despite a boycott by the United States. Director of Anglo-American La wat Cergy-Paris University and West African politics expert, Douglas Yates, shares his insights.

items.title: 11 injured after grizzly bear attacks group of elementary school students
items.standfirst: A grizzly bear attacked a group of elementary school students and their teachers in British Columbia, injuring 11 people. Authorities say teachers were able to use bear spray and bear bangers to scare off the grizzly. NBC News’ Morgan Chesky reports.
items.content: A grizzly bear attacked a group of elementary school students and their teachers in British Columbia, injuring 11 people. Authorities say teachers were able to use bear spray and bear bangers to scare off the grizzly. NBC News’ Morgan Chesky reports.

items.title: Eleven injured after grizzly bear attacks schoolchildren and teachers in Canada
items.standfirst: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...
items.content: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Hero' teachers fended off grizzly that attacked students on Canada walking trail, injuring 11, officials said
items.standfirst: Teachers who were well prepared and well equipped may have ended a grizzly bear attack on their group of Canadian schoolchildren in British Columbia this week before it became deadly, authorities said
items.content: Teachers who were well prepared and well equipped may have ended a grizzly bear attack on their group of Canadian schoolchildren in British Columbia this week before it became deadly, authorities said

ai_summary: A grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers in British Columbia, Canada.
Eleven people were injured, with two suffering critical injuries from the attack.
The attack occurred on a walking trail in Bella Coola, approximately 435 miles from Vancouver.
Teachers reportedly used bear spray and bear bangers to deter the aggressive bear.
Police and conservation officers are actively searching for the grizzly bear involved.

clusters.title: Here's what experts say is behind bitcoin's $800 billion drop
clusters.neutral_headline: Here's what experts say is behind bitcoin's $800 billion drop

items.title: Here's what experts say is behind bitcoin's $800 billion drop
items.standfirst: Bitcoin has erased all of its 2025 gains and is on track for its worst monthly performance since 2022. Here's what experts say about the decline.
items.content: Bitcoin has erased all of its 2025 gains and is on track for its worst monthly performance since 2022. Here's what experts say about the decline.

items.title: Bitcoin Heading for Worst Month Since Crypto Collapse of 2022
items.standfirst: Bitcoin is on track for its worst monthly performance since a string of corporate collapses rocked the wider crypto sector in 2022.
items.content: Bitcoin is on track for its worst monthly performance since a string of corporate collapses rocked the wider crypto sector in 2022.

ai_summary: Bitcoin has lost all gains made in 2024 and is on track for a poor monthly performance.
Experts are analyzing the reasons behind the significant decline in Bitcoin's value.
The current performance is potentially the worst since the 2022 crypto collapse.
The decline follows a period of gains, now completely erased by the market.
The drop has erased $800 billion in value, according to the reports.
